gurmukhi: ਦ੍ਰਿਗਨ ਕੳੁ ਜਿਹਬਾ ਸ੍ਵਨ ਜੳੁ ਮਿਲਹਿ ਜੈਸੇ ਦੇਖੈ ਤੈਸੇ ਕਹਿ ਸੁਨਿ ਗੁਨ ਗਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Drigan Kau Jihabaa Sravan Jau Milahi , Jaisay Daykhai Taisay Kahi Souni Goun Gaavahee ?
translation: If eyes get tongue and ears, then whatever it sees and hears with ears, it will then describe the reality and convey it.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਵਨ ਜਿਹਬਾ ਅੳੁ ਲੋਚਨ ਮਿਲੈ ਦਿਅਾਲ ਜੈਸੋ ਸੁਨੈ ਤੈਸੋ ਦੇਖਿ ਕਹਿ ਸਮਝਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Sravan Jihabaa Au Lochan Milai Diaala , Jaiso Sounai Taiso Daykhi Kahi Samajhaavahee ?
translation: If by the kindness of Almighty, the ears get tongue and eyes, then they will speak with tongue, what they see with eyes and hear.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਹਬਾ ਕੳੁ ਲੋਚਨ ਸ੍ਵਨ ਜੳੁ ਮਿਲਹਿ ਦੇਵ ਜੈਸੋ ਕਹੈ ਤੈਸੋ ਸੁਨਿ ਦੇਖਿ ਅੳੁ ਦਿਖਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Jihabaa Kau Lochan Sravan Jau Milahi Dayva , Jaiso Kahai Taiso Souni Daykhi Au Dikhaavahee ?
translation: If the Almighty God bless the tongue with eyes .and ears it will say what it sees with eyes and hears with ears.

gurmukhi: ਨੈਨ ਜੀਹ ਸ੍ਵਨ ਸ੍ਵਨ ਲੋਚਨ ਜੀਹ ਜਿਹਬਾ ਨ ਸ੍ਵਨ ਲੋਚਨ ਲਲਚਾਵਹੀ ॥੩੯੭॥
transliteration: Nain Jeeh Sravan Sravan Lochan Jeeha , Jihabaa N Sravan Lochan Lalachaavahee ?397?
translation: Eyes need co-operation of tongue and ears, the ears need full co-operation of tongue and eyes but just as Guru Nanak on page 1091 of Guru Granth Sahib says '.'Jeebh rasayan chuni rati lal lavaaye" (Sucking the elixir-like Naam, meditating on Lord's name,
